data.text: How 2:1 This chapter is an acrostic poem, each verse beginning with the successive letters of the Hebrew alphabet. the Lord has covered the Daughter of Zion
Without pity the Lord has swallowed up
In fierce anger He has cut off
He has bent His bow like an enemy;
The Lord is like an enemy;
He has laid waste His tabernacle like a garden booth;
The Lord has rejected His altar;
The LORD determined to destroy
Her gates have sunk into the ground;
The elders of the Daughter of Zion
My eyes fail from weeping;
They cry out to their mothers:
What can I say for you?
The visions of your prophets
All who pass by
All your enemies
The LORD has done what He planned;
The hearts of the people
Arise, cry out in the night
Look, O LORD, and consider:
Both young and old lie together
You summoned my attackers on every side,
